citations.title: Choose one familiar dataset (e.g., CIFAR-10 for vision, SST-2 or AG News for NLP) and one baseline model (e.g., ResNet-18, DistilBERT) so you can iterate fast. Residual networks are a solid, well-documented baseline [He et al., 2016](
Core theory: work through 2–3 chapters of Goodfellow, Bengio, Courville’s Deep Learning (free online), focusing on optimization and CNNs/sequence models as needed [Goodfellow et al., 2016](
Practical stack: Python + PyTorch. Use the official PyTorch tutorials for dataloaders, training loops, and checkpoints (
Short courses by topic (pick one): CS231n for vision ( CS224n for NLP (http://web.stanford.edu/class/cs224n/).
Short courses by topic (pick one): CS231n for vision (http://cs231n.stanford.edu/), CS224n for NLP (
Hypothesis: AdamW yields better test accuracy than Adam at matched learning-rate schedules by decoupling weight decay [Loshchilov & Hutter, 2019](

Hypothesis: Mixup improves generalization more than label smoothing at the same effective regularization strength on CIFAR-100 [Zhang et al., 2018]( [Müller et al., 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.02629).

Hypothesis: Mixup improves generalization more than label smoothing at the same effective regularization strength on CIFAR-100 [Zhang et al., 2018](https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.09412); [Müller et al., 2019](
Hypothesis: Moderate LR warmup (e.g., 2–4% of total steps) improves convergence and final validation accuracy over no warmup on a small Transformer text classifier [Vaswani et al., 2017](
Hypothesis: Validation loss decreases roughly as a power law with parameter count for small Transformers trained on a fixed dataset size, before overfitting dominates [Kaplan et al., 2020](
Useful knobs to study: AdamW [Loshchilov & Hutter, 2019]( mixup [Zhang et al., 2018](https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.09412), label smoothing [Müller et al., 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.02629).
Useful knobs to study: AdamW [Loshchilov & Hutter, 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.05101), mixup [Zhang et al., 2018]( label smoothing [Müller et al., 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1906.02629).
Goodfellow, Bengio, Courville (2016). Deep Learning
He et al. (2016). Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition
Vaswani et al. (2017). Attention Is All You Need
Loshchilov & Hutter (2019). Decoupled Weight Decay Regularization (AdamW)
Zhang et al. (2018). mixup: Beyond Empirical Risk Minimization
Müller et al. (2019). When Does Label Smoothing Help?
Kaplan et al. (2020). Scaling Laws for Neural Language Models
PyTorch Tutorials
CS231n
CS224n

judges.raw: {"score": 2.0, "rationale": "The agent provides a comprehensive and actionable plan for a beginner to start AI research. It breaks down the process into manageable steps, suggests specific subareas, datasets, and models, and recommends relevant theoretical and practical resources. Crucially, it outlines a minimal research workflow and proposes three concrete, falsifiable experiments with clear hypotheses, setups, metrics, and falsification conditions, all supported by citations to seminal papers. The advice is grounded in evidence and directly addresses the user's need to know where to start.", "confidence": "high"}
